definition: bird/CL:隻|只[zhi1],群[qun2]/(dialect) to pay attention to/(intensifier) damned/goddam

sentences.english: Small finch-like indonesian weaverbird that frequents rice fields.
sentences.chinese: 经常在稻田活动的印尼类似雀鸟的小织巢鸟。

sentences.english: The bird control unit consists of about 15 specially-trained staff.
sentences.chinese: 雀鸟管制组约有15名成员，他们都经过特别训练。

sentences.english: Mine enemies chased me sore, like a bird, without cause.
sentences.chinese: 无故与我为仇的追逼我，像追雀鸟一样。

sentences.english: Can a bird fall in a snare upon the earth, where no gin is for him?
sentences.chinese: 若没有机槛，雀鸟岂能陷在网罗里呢。

sentences.english: Junction between two rivers there is a small island like a bird paradise.
sentences.chinese: 两河之间的交汇处有一小岛，犹如一个雀鸟天堂。

sentences.english: By hanging CD, reflected light can prevent birds to eat the ripe tomatoes.
sentences.chinese: 挂光碟可反射光线，阻吓雀鸟啄食成熟的蕃茄。

sentences.english: It is not easy to monitor if birds are killed.
sentences.chinese: 不容易确定有没有雀鸟中招。

sentences.english: There is also a Bird Theatre where there are bird shows.
sentences.chinese: 那里也有一个鸟类表演的雀鸟剧场。

sentences.english: Give two characteristics which set birds apart from all other creatures.
sentences.chinese: 列出两个雀鸟的特征，使牠们与其他生物分别出来。

sentences.english: On the trail of a bird.
Walk through the Bird Garden to the junction of Yuen Po Street and Flower Market Road.
sentences.chinese: 横过雀鸟花园，前往园圃街和花墟道交界。

sentences.english: In most birds the male is bigger and brighter in colour than the female.
sentences.chinese: 雀鸟多半雄比雌体形大，羽色鲜艳。

definition: to go off like a rocket/to rocket
to scare a bird into flight
